result.execSummary:
All charges against Thomas Smith Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Smith Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Smith Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Smith Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Thomas Smith Jr.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Thomas Smith Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Thomas Smith Jr. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 9-6-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
filed.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
Final pretrial scheduled for 8-12-22 at 8:30 am is rescheduled to 9-1-22 at 8:30 am.  The Court is down on 8-12-22.  All parties agreed upon new court date via email.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
State's Jury Instructions, filed.
filed.

Defendant Thomas Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for defense's bail motion.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense's motion to modify cash bail amount.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and speedy jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. exp 9/15/2022

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Thomas Smith in court by video with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask who appears in person.  Defendant Thomas Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. and requests to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Thomas Smith not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for State v. Lee hearing.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DLH (DOB: 03/27/1988)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Smith Jr
Current: 3913 N 26th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 2822 North 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Thomas Smith in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Thomas Smith in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Motion to dismiss "domestic abuse repeater" 939.621(1)(b) enhancer by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 10.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
